title: Drawing, October 1856
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on tan wove paper
markings:
Recto: Stamped in black ink, at lower left: Museum for Arts of Decoration - Cooper Union
Verso: Stamped in black ink, at lower center: Museum of Arts of Decoration - Cooper Union
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in black ink: salman / Bright; and dated at bottom right: Oct. 1856.
Verso: Inscribed in graphite: gross water
description: Horseshoe Falls and Goat Island are shown from the Canadian bank; Terrapin Tower is visible at left, above the falls on the far side. On the verso of the sheet there is a rough sketch of a wooded landscape.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, October 1856.
October 1856. Graphite, brush and white gouache on tan wove paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-33-a.
